name: standouts_title_genres_plot
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title, genres, plot
Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
You should consider the given title, genres, plot for every movie.

Identify movies that stand out from the rest in genre, tone, or theme, as they can impact perceived diversity of the list.  
A list of movies with similar features may feel more diverse if it includes one or more outliers.  

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C
    "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
    "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
    "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
}

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
GENRES: Action, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

TITLE: Snatch (2000)
GENRES: Comedy, Crime
PLOT: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
GENRES: Action, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.

TITLE: Jurassic Park (1993)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Thriller
PLOT: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Comedy, Sci-Fi
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Others, The (2001)
GENRES: Horror, Mystery, Thriller
PLOT: In 1945, immediately following the end of Second World War, a woman who lives with her two photosensitive children on her darkened old family estate in the Channel Islands becomes convinced that the home is haunted.

TITLE: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)
GENRES: Biography, Drama
PLOT: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

TITLE: The Hunger Games (2012)
GENRES: Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Thriller
PLOT: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety. It includes action thrillers (Bourne series), crime comedies (Snatch), science fiction adventures (Jurassic Park, Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2, The Hunger Games), horror (The Others), and biographical drama (A Beautiful Mind).  The inclusion of Jurassic Park and The Others provides genre variety, while A Beautiful Mind offers a tonal shift from the action-oriented films.
response.list_B_description: List B has a good mix of genres and tones. It features science fiction adventure (Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2), biographical crime drama (Catch Me If You Can), horror (The Others), comedy-drama (Moonrise Kingdom), drama (Rain Man), action sci-fi (The Avengers), comedy (School of Rock), and war drama (Inglourious Basterds). The range of tones and settings makes it diverse.
response.list_C_description: List C is quite similar to List A in terms of genre diversity, with action thrillers (Bourne series), science fiction adventure (Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 2, Edge of Tomorrow, War of the Worlds), horror (The Others), and drama (Rain Man).  However, it lacks the crime and comedy elements present in List A and B. The inclusion of War of the Worlds adds a significant element of scale and scope, different from the other films.
response.comparison: Lists A, B, and C all offer a diverse selection of movies across various genres and tones. List A and C share a similar core of action thrillers and sci-fi adventures, but List A adds crime and comedy elements, while List C includes more sci-fi and a war film. List B stands out with a broader range of genres, including war, music, and family films, offering a more eclectic mix.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List B exhibits the most diversity because it encompasses a wider array of genres and tones.  It includes comedy (School of Rock, Moonrise Kingdom), war (Inglourious Basterds), family (Moonrise Kingdom), music (School of Rock), and various subgenres within drama, action, and sci-fi. This broader spectrum of genres and tones makes it more diverse than Lists A and C, which, while diverse, are more focused on action, thriller, and sci-fi elements.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety. It includes war drama, psychological drama, animation, biographical drama, and sci-fi thriller.  The inclusion of Up and Finding Dory (family animation) provides a contrast to the more serious and mature themes of the other films.  However, several films share the drama genre.
response.list_B_description: List B has a similar range to List A, but with a stronger action/adventure emphasis.  The inclusion of Mr. & Mrs. Smith adds a comedic action element, while Sherlock Holmes and Rogue One add further action-adventure variety.  However, like List A, there's a concentration of drama and crime genres.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a good mix of genres and tones. It features war, action, sci-fi, crime, and western elements. The inclusion of Hacksaw Ridge (biographical war drama), Hell or High Water (western crime drama), and Maze Runner (sci-fi action) provides a nice contrast to the other films. The presence of Avengers: Infinity War adds a significant element of high-stakes superhero action.
response.comparison: All three lists contain some overlap (Saving Private Ryan and Goodfellas appear in all three). List A and B are quite similar in their genre distribution, leaning towards drama and crime. List C stands out with a more diverse range of genres and tones, including western and superhero elements, offering a more varied viewing experience.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C exhibits the most diversity because it successfully blends genres and tones. While Lists A and B have some variety, they are heavily weighted towards drama and crime. List C's inclusion of a western (Hell or High Water), a superhero epic (Avengers: Infinity War), and a unique sci-fi thriller (Maze Runner) alongside war and action films creates a more balanced and engaging collection.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a broad range of genres and tones. It includes animation (Inside Out), thrillers (Shutter Island, Split), Sci-Fi (The Matrix), drama (Shawshank Redemption, Requiem for a Dream), crime (Pulp Fiction), and biographical elements (Intouchables).  The inclusion of lighter fare like Inside Out and Intouchables balances the darker themes of films like Requiem for a Dream and Shutter Island, creating diversity.
response.list_B_description: List B also demonstrates genre variety, encompassing Sci-Fi (Avatar, WALLÂ·E), comedy (Being John Malkovich, Little Miss Sunshine), drama (Shawshank Redemption, A Beautiful Mind, 28 Days Later), and war (1917). However, it has a slightly more serious tone overall compared to List A, with fewer comedic elements.
response.list_C_description: List C presents a blend of action (Avatar, 1917), Sci-Fi (Avatar, Gravity), comedy (Being John Malkovich, Knives Out), drama (Intouchables, Gravity), and thriller (Shutter Island, Knives Out).  The inclusion of Knives Out adds a unique comedic mystery element, while Gravity provides a different kind of Sci-Fi experience compared to Avatar.  The list feels well-rounded.
response.comparison: All three lists exhibit diversity in genre. List A stands out with a more balanced mix of lighthearted and serious films, creating a wider tonal range. List B leans more towards serious dramas and Sci-Fi, while List C offers a good balance but perhaps lacks the extreme tonal contrast of List A.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A is chosen as the most diverse because it successfully combines a variety of genres with a significant contrast in tone. The inclusion of lighter films like Inside Out and Intouchables alongside darker, more intense movies like Requiem for a Dream and Shutter Island creates a more dynamic and engaging range of viewing experiences than the other lists.

response.list_B_description: List B has a good mix of genres, including action (Kill Bill, Rogue One), comedy (Meet the Parents, Silver Linings Playbook), sci-fi (WALL-E, Rogue One), horror (Get Out), and animation (WALL-E, Pocahontas). response.list_C_description: List C offers a strong blend of genres and tones. It features action (Guardians of the Galaxy, Kill Bill, Wonder Woman), drama (Schindler's List, Silver Linings Playbook), sci-fi (Guardians of the Galaxy, WALL-E), horror (Get Out), animation (WALL-E), and comedy (Meet the Parents). Wonder Woman adds a unique superhero element with a strong female lead.
response.comparison: All three lists contain some overlap (Kill Bill, WALL-E, Meet the Parents). List A is somewhat less diverse due to a cluster of similar family-friendly animated films. List B is more diverse than A, but List C stands out with a broader range of genres and a more pronounced contrast in tones and themes, particularly with the inclusion of Schindler's List, Get Out, and Wonder Woman, which offer significant thematic and stylistic differences from the other entries.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C exhibits the most diversity because it successfully balances a variety of genres (action, animation, drama, horror, sci-fi, comedy) while also incorporating films with significantly different tones and themes. The inclusion of Schindler's List (serious historical drama), Get Out (horror with social commentary), and Wonder Woman (superhero film with a strong female protagonist) creates a compelling contrast that elevates the overall diversity of the list.

response.list_A_description: List A shows a decent variety. It includes genres like drama, mystery, thriller, crime, animation, action, adventure, comedy, family, fantasy, sci-fi, romance, horror, and biography.  There's a mix of tones, from the suspenseful thrillers to the heartwarming family film Big Hero 6 and the comedic Shaun of the Dead.  The inclusion of Hidden Figures adds a historical element, further diversifying the list.
response.list_B_description: List B has a more limited scope than List A. While it still contains a mix of genres (animation, action, adventure, comedy, drama, thriller, crime, romance, and horror), the overall tone is less diverse.  Many films lean towards action, adventure, or thriller, with fewer outliers to balance the selection.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a good balance.  It features animation, adventure, drama, family, fantasy, music, mystery, comedy, crime, horror, romance, and sci-fi.  The inclusion of films like Coco and O Brother, Where Art Thou? adds unique musical and comedic elements that stand out from the more common drama and thriller entries.  The presence of Gattaca adds a distinct sci-fi element.
response.comparison: List A and List C are more diverse than List B. List A has a broader range of genres and tones, including a biographical film. List C has a strong mix of genres and includes some unique entries like Coco and O Brother, Where Art Thou?, which add to its diversity. List B feels somewhat homogenous, with several films sharing similar action-adventure or thriller themes.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List A edges out List C due to its inclusion of a biographical film (Hidden Figures), which provides a unique perspective and thematic element not present in List C.  The variety of genres and tones in List A, combined with the presence of Hidden Figures, makes it slightly more diverse than List C.
